text: The Brearley School is an all-girls private school in New York City. It was started by Samuel A. Brearley in 1884. It costs $39,900 a term. Famous women who went there include Dorothy Schiff, Erica Wagner, Sara Moulton, and Virginia Gildersleeve. == References == Category:Schools in Manhattan Category:1884 establishments in the United States Category:1880s establishments in New York (state)
title: Brearley School
